results.title: Coal from Westland
results.brief_description: Coal mining in the forest mountain of Westland, New Zealand. Shows miners at work in coal pits, at home with their families and enjoying leisure hours. The camera explores the rugged beauty of the mountains and deep gorges surrounding the mines.

results.title: Coal Dust the Invisible Killer
results.brief_description: High productivity at the coalface means increased dust, a major health hazard to the miner. Using diagrams and an actual lung a doctor explains how and what diseases are caused by prolonged exposure to coal dust, and answers key questions of concern to every miner. Strong emphasis is given to suppressing dust at source through effective ventilation and water sprays, combines with statutory monitoring of dust, regular X-Ray and medical examinations. Protection today prevents pneumoconiosis tomorrow.

results.title: Coaching on the job (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This instructional video aims to help employees recognise when their staff have training needs and how to respond so that these training needs are met. Five steps are identified. Step one is to determine the need for coaching. This can be done by observation or be simply asking the employee what their training needs are. The second step is to explain the task or activity that needs doing. The third step is to demonstrate the activity in question. The fourth step is to practice the task. The fifth step is to ask for feedback. With re-enactments the video shows successful and not so successful methods of coaching with suggestions of how to amend each style.

results.title: Coaching for the first time
results.creator_credit: Ron Tindall and Dep for Youth, Sport and Recreation, Western Australia
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of what is involved for the newcomer to coaching child athletes. Stresses that winning isn’t everything. Considers the role of the parent as a coach and finally highlights the skills necessary to be a good coach.

results.title: Coaching for improved performance
results.brief_description: In most organisations there are people who would benefit from training. This recognition, that improving employees performance is not a one off process, but one that should be continually developed, is crucial. This video provides managers and supervisors with the skills needed to become successful instructors, or coaches, in the workplace. The video follows a middle level manager in a typically structured organisation, who has recognised that a number of staff could benefit from coaching to improve their performance. Ten key skills of successful coaches are illustrated with practical examples. Pause breaks are included on the tape to allow for integration with the training guide.

results.title: Coaches
results.creator_credit: Paul Cowan, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Coaches is about four people preparing their teams for the Pre-Olympics. Their distinctive approaches emerge during the fights, the good times, and those critical post-game sessions when feelings are raw or jubilant. It is a film about human growth.

results.title: Co Hoedeman: animator
results.creator_credit: Nico Crama, Henk Suer, Barrie Howells, Tom Daly, Nederlandse Omroep Stichting and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Academy Award-winning filmmaker, Co Hoedeman, divides his time between family, farm, and studio. This film, while showing all three aspects of his life, places particular emphasis on his work as an animator. He is shown working on a short animation clip, created especially for the film. Excerpts of his films are shown. Voice and narration by Richard Gilbert. (Award: Montreal)
